channel.title: Compiler issues
channel.description: I'm using an older 'retro' server and my old compiler is saying I do not have Java installed..(I do..) so is there an easy way to fix this or a way to find a working compiler?

item.title: Compiler issues
item.dc:creator: @recluse recluse
item.description:
@recluse wrote:

Try using this compiler code hopefully this helps.

@echo off Title Compiling... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
Remember to put the Java version to your Java version.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issues
item.dc:creator: @MakeSamichWoman MakeSamichWoman
item.description:
@MakeSamichWoman wrote:

Not quite sure what to change eh’

@echo off @TITLE Runelegion compiler made by runelegion if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

This is where my Java is located

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_23

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issues
item.dc:creator: @Scaar1 Scaar
item.description:
@Scaar1 wrote:

MakeSamichWoman:

I’m using an older ‘retro’ server and my old compiler is saying I do not have Java installed…(I do…) so is there an easy way to fix this or a way to find a working compiler?

Edit teh compiler to whatever version of java you have
